cases.input: 58-year-old male presenting with crushing chest pain radiating to left arm for 45 minutes. History of hypertension, smoker. Diaphoretic, BP 160/95, HR 110, SpO2 94%. Denies nausea.
72-year-old female with sudden onset right-sided weakness and facial droop starting 30 minutes ago. Slurred speech noted. History of atrial fibrillation. BP 185/100, HR 88 irregular.
28-year-old female with sudden onset lip swelling, throat tightness, and widespread urticaria 10 minutes after eating shellfish. Known shellfish allergy. Stridor audible, SpO2 91%, HR 120.
3-year-old male brought in by parents, had generalized tonic-clonic seizure lasting 5 minutes at home. Currently postictal, drowsy. Temperature 39.8°C. No seizure history. No medications.
35-year-old male presenting with acute distress, reports wanting to die. Has a plan involving medications. History of depression, recently lost job. Denies substance use today.
